translation.en: [in Yiddish] Esty! You can't go out!

translation.ja: 〈なぜ？〉 〈結界(エルブ)のワイヤが強風で切れたのよ〉

translation.en: High winds broke a wire just down the street.
translation.ja: 〈結界(エルブ)のワイヤが強風で切れたのよ〉

translation.en: -Someone will fix it. -[woman 2] Tomorrow. Not on the Sabbath!
translation.ja: 〈修理は？〉 〈安息日だもの明日にならないと〉

translation.en: I can't go to my mother's for lunch!
translation.ja: 〈安息日だもの明日にならないと〉

translation.en: And I have an excuse to avoid my mother-in-law!
translation.ja: 〈姑(しゅうとめ)に会いに行かなくて済むわ〉

translation.en: You know, Esty's not trapped like we are! She doesn't have a baby to carry.
translation.ja: 〈子供がいないと身軽でいいわね〉

translation.en: Good point! Just leave your bag upstairs.
translation.ja: 〈バッグは家に置いて行かなきゃ〉

translation.en: -Where are you going? -To my parents-in-law. For lunch.
translation.ja: 〈どこへ？〉 〈夫の実家でランチなの〉
〈やあ　安息日おめでとう〉

translation.en: [Yanky] I don't know. She wasn't sick when I left this morning.
translation.ja: 〈今朝 家を出た時は元気だったよ〉

translation.en: It's always something with Esty, isn't it?

translation.ja: 航空券とパスポートよ
ありがとう いいのよ　２分で来る

translation.en: Go the long way around Williamsburg, please.
translation.ja: ウィリアムズバーグは避けて

translation.en: [in Yiddish] Yanky, shouldn't you be at the synagogue?
She wasn't home after lunch yesterday and she never came home last night.
translation.ja: 〈昨日 家に帰ったら留守で夜も戻らなかった〉

translation.en: Has she been in an accident?
That girl was never good enough for you!
-[man 4] Mimi! -[Mimi] She was trouble from the start.
A year of marriage and not even a baby!
translation.ja: 〈結婚して１年経つのに子供もいない〉

translation.en: We shouldn't have agreed to the match.
Fine. I'll go see the rabbi.
translation.ja: 〈分かったラビに会ってくる〉

translation.en: [Esty's grandma] My father loved this song.
He had a wonderful voice, Esty.
translation.ja: 〈お前のひいおじいさんはね〉

translation.en: All the men in his family did.
translation.ja: 〈うちの男の人はみんなそうだった〉
〈戦争の前ハンガリーにいた時？〉

translation.en: But soon you'll have children of your own.
translation.ja: 〈でも お前もやがて子供に恵まれる〉

translation.en: -Grandpa will be home any minute. -[Esty] He's not here yet!
translation.ja: 〈おじいちゃんが戻るわ〉 〈まだよ〉

translation.en: So he'll hear women singing when he arrives? No.
translation.ja: 〈女の歌なんて聞かせられない〉

translation.en: [in English] Listen. [in Yiddish] The matchmaker made a suggestion.
The Shapiros near the Navy Yard.
translation.ja: 〈ネイビーヤードのシャピロ家〉
〈宝石商の？〉 〈兄弟だけで切り盛りしてる〉

translation.en: But the father has never worked.
translation.ja: 〈兄弟だけで切り盛りしてる〉

translation.en: -He sits and studies! -[Esty's grandma in English] That's good!
translation.ja: 〈父親は隠居生活〉 そりゃいい

translation.en: -[in Yiddish] What's the boy like? -What's the boy like?
Your marriage will mark the beginning of a new life!
translation.ja: 〈結婚して新しい人生を始めるんだよ〉

translation.en: [Malka in English] Hold on a minute.
[in Yiddish] Let's wait till the Shapiros agree to the match, alright? After all, Esty is an orphan.
translation.ja: 〈向こうが孤児との結婚に難色を示すかも〉
〈放蕩(ほうとう)息子の帰還か〉

translation.en: You're not staying for the meal?
[in Yiddish] Tell us everything about your wife, Yanky.
I'm in Manhattan during the day. I work with my brothers in the business now.
translation.ja: 〈僕は仕事があるので昼間はマンハッタンに〉

translation.en: Esty does what all the other wives do.
She shops, she cooks, she visits her grandmother...
Esty isn't like the other wives.
Yanky, come on! She doesn't even visit with them.
Yanky, admit it. You have no idea how Esty spends the day.
translation.ja: 〈君は昼間のエスティを知らないだろ〉

translation.en: Gentlemen. The point is, we can't have our people losing their way.
translation.ja: 〈とにかく道に迷った仲間を放っておくことはできない〉

translation.en: We need to find this young woman and bring her back to her husband!
translation.ja: 〈彼女を見つけ出し夫の元に帰す〉

translation.en: -I've asked your cousin Moishe to help. -Moishe?
translation.ja: 〈君のいとこのモイシェが手伝う〉

translation.en: The rabbi understands that Moishe has his own problems, right?
translation.ja: 〈モイシェが抱えてる問題はご存じでしょう〉

translation.en: Not to mention, in his marriage.
"A Jew, though he sinned, is still a Jew."

translation.ja: 〈シムハ　神を信じなさい〉

translation.en: Moishe is the one to find your son's wife.
translation.ja: 〈君の息子の妻は彼が見つける〉

translation.en: How far can she possibly have gone?
Miriam Shapiro wants to see you.
How will I know which one she is?
Now walk as if you're looking for something. With a smile.

translation.ja: フラットホワイト？ 普通のを

translation.en: [barista] Would you like to see a menu?

translation.ja: 違うよ　コーヒーのことさ

translation.en: You have a lot of friends.
Yeah. A lot of tired friends.
translation.ja: ああ　疲れた友達がね

translation.en: -[barista] That will be two euros, twenty. -Yes.
-[in English] Here we are. Coffee! -[man 7] Oh, nice!
translation.ja: コーヒーだぞ ありがたい

translation.en: -They're all the same. -[woman 7] Thanks. You're so sweet.
translation.ja: 全部同じさ 優しいのね

translation.en: -[in German] We'll start in a minute. -OK, I'm coming.
[in English] We have to bring these inside, because we have a rehearsal now.
translation.ja: これからリハーサルなんだ
助かったよ　じゃあ

translation.en: -See you around. -[woman 8] See you around, Esty.
translation.ja: 助かったよ　じゃあ またね　エスティ

translation.en: I'm assuming you all stayed in last night and practiced your parts?
translation.ja: 昨夜は さぞ練習に励んだんだろうな

translation.en: Can anyone think of a better way to spend a Saturday evening in Berlin?
translation.ja: 土曜の夜の最高の過ごし方だ

translation.en: [teacher] Ready? Let's start from the trio of the second movement.
translation.ja: では第２楽章の三重奏から始めよう

translation.en: Peace be upon you! How do you do?
Don't forget, Esty. He speaks first.
My father took me and my brothers to Europe last spring.
translation.ja: 〈去年の春 父とヨーロッパに行ったんだ〉

translation.en: We visited the graves of all the famous rabbis.
translation.ja: 〈有名なラビの墓地を回った〉

translation.en: You went all the way to Europe and all you saw were graves?
translation.ja: 〈ヨーロッパまで行って見たのは墓地だけ？〉

translation.en: but my father didn't allow it.
I want to go back someday.
They say London and Paris are beautiful.
I've never been anywhere but New York.
My brothers and I sometimes perform together with my father.
translation.ja: 〈僕たち兄弟と父とで時々 演奏もする〉

translation.en: I mean, do you like music?
I bet you sound beautiful when you play together.
translation.ja: 〈家族で演奏なんてすてきでしょうね〉

translation.en: I hope to see it one day.
I'm not like the other girls.
I'm different from the other girls.
[in English] I'll get the car, guys.

translation.ja: すてきなコンサートだった

translation.en: It was the most beautiful thing I have ever heard.
translation.ja: あんな美しい音楽は初めて
あんな美しい音楽は初めて よかった

translation.en: -[man 8] I'm ready. -Let's go! Come on. Dasia!
translation.ja: 行くわよ ぐずぐずしないで

translation.en: I have to practice. What the hell am I supposed to do?
translation.ja: そんな余裕ないよ　練習だ
ヴァンゼーだ　湖さ

translation.en: [in Yiddish] You spoke to her mother?
You know she doesn't have a mother. Just a grandmother and an aunt.
My cousin, Moishe Lefkovitch. You remember him.
We're here to ask you and your mother that question exactly.
Now it's my job to keep track of your wife?
She hasn't been home since yesterday.
[Malka] Nobody can find out about this.
-Can we ask your mother a few questions? -[Malka] No!
You want to scare an old woman? Her life hasn't been difficult enough?
translation.ja: 〈散々 苦しんだのにまだおびえさせるの？〉

translation.en: It's as she left it when she moved out to get married.
[woman 9 in English] Yeah, I'm teaching a class!
I am Mordecai Schwartz. This is my daughter.
translation.ja: 俺はシュワルツ　これは娘

translation.en: We're here to collect the rent.
I have a tour coming up in two weeks, OK? It's two weeks in the Midwest.
translation.ja: ２週間後に中西部をツアーで回るの

translation.en: I'll get paid right after. And then I can pay you the back rent.
translation.ja: 滞納してる分はそのギャラで払う

translation.en: And then I'll pay you three months in advance, OK?
translation.ja: ３ヵ月分 前払いもするわ

translation.en: Yeah, I'm good for it. I just need two weeks.
[in English] George? I'll just be one more minute, OK? -Sorry about this. -[Mordecai in Yiddish] Dad...
translation.ja: ジョージもう少し待ってて

translation.en: -[Mordecai in Yiddish] So what? What? -[in English] Do you play?
translation.ja: 〈それが何か？〉 あなたもピアノを？

translation.en: I mean, sometimes when nobody sees.
translation.ja: 誰も見てない時に少しだけ

translation.en: Anyway, we don't have one at home.
[in Yiddish] Why did you send me? Go yourself!
-[in English] You're welcome to play here. -[Mordecai in Yiddish] I don't know!
translation.ja: ここで弾いたら？ 〈知るか！〉

translation.en: [in English] If you want, I could teach you.
[man 8] Is this your first time in Berlin, Esty?
[in German] Let's show her something nice.
-[in English] Let's go! -Like what? Hitler's bunker?
translation.ja: いいね ヒトラーの地下壕(ごう)は？

translation.en: -It's still there? -No, she's just messing with you.
translation.ja: 今もあるの？ からかってるだけさ

translation.en: Or we can take selfies at the memorial to the murdered Jews of Europe.
translation.ja: ユダヤ人虐殺記念碑で自撮りとか

translation.en: That, Yael, is a superb idea.
And the memorial to the murdered homosexuals is just across the street.
translation.ja: ゲイの虐殺記念碑も目の前だし―

translation.en: And while we're at it, there's one to the murdered Sinti and Romas nearby, too.
translation.ja: シンティとロマの虐殺記念碑も近い

translation.en: -[woman 7] You don't sound like it. -I've never been anywhere else.
translation.ja: 意外だな 他の土地は知らない

translation.en: Yemen. But I grew up near Munich.
translation.ja: イエメン生まれのミュンヘン育ち

translation.en: And I'm from Israel, Ahmed is from Nigeria,
translation.ja: 私はイスラエル彼はナイジェリア

translation.en: Clemens... is German, but your parents came from...?
translation.ja: クレメンスはドイツだけど両親は…

translation.en: And Robert is the only one of us who is actually from Berlin.
translation.ja: ベルリン出身なのはロバートだけ

translation.en: So he can answer all your burning questions about the war.
translation.ja: 戦争のことは彼に聞いて

translation.en: My grandparents lost their whole families in the camps.
translation.ja: 祖父母は家族を殺された

translation.en: But we're too busy defending our present to be sentimental about our past.
translation.ja: でも国防に忙しくて過去を嘆く暇はない

translation.en: [Robert] You know what's funny? -Yael always talks big, big, big-- -A lot of talking.
translation.ja: ヤエルはいつだって大げさなんだよ

translation.en: [Robert] Yeah, a lot of talking. But she's never been in military combat. She was playing the violin in the military orchestra.
translation.ja: 所属してたのは軍楽隊で戦闘経験もないのに

translation.en: -Oh, is it? -Yeah. Like Vivaldi's "Four Seasons" every weekend, madam?
translation.ja: ビバルディの“四季”とか弾いてたわけ？
ベートーベンの“第九”も弾いた

translation.en: -Not like you. -Robert... I play some piano.
translation.ja: ピアノは弾くけどレベルが違うわ

translation.en: Well, at least you have a life. [giggles]
translation.ja: 少なくとも趣味はある

translation.en: The conference where the Nazis decided to kill the Jews in the concentration camps took place in 1942...
translation.ja: 1942年 ナチスはユダヤ人を収容して殺すことを決めた

translation.en: And you swim in this lake?
Well, the lake is just a lake.
When the Berlin Wall was up, East German guards shot anyone who tried to swim across this lake to freedom.
translation.ja: 泳いで西へ逃れようとすると東ドイツ兵に撃ち殺された

translation.en: Now you can swim as far as you like.
You go in. I'll watch everyone's stuff.
translation.ja: 荷物は見てるから泳いだら？

translation.en: You can't just come into my apartment like this!
translation.ja: 勝手に入ってこないで

translation.en: I've been paying my rent on time!
You know exactly who I'm talking about.
-Moishe! -Jesus! What is wrong with you people?
translation.ja: 何するのよどういうつもり？

translation.en: She quit the piano lessons for you.
Tell me where to find her.
-I don't know. -[Moishe] Alright, Ms. Vivian Dropkin.
translation.ja: 知らないわ 居場所を教えないなら電気を止める

translation.en: If you don't tell us where she is, we'll cut off your electricity.
translation.ja: 居場所を教えないなら電気を止める

translation.en: Moishe, stop! [in Yiddish] Maybe she doesn't know anything.
translation.ja: 〈やめるんだ本当に知らないのかも〉

translation.en: [in English] We'll cut off your internet. And then we'll cancel your lease.
translation.ja: ネットも止めて賃貸契約を解除する

translation.en: -[Dasia] Ahmed doesn't know any German. -[Esty] Really?
translation.ja: アハメドはドイツ語を話せないの

translation.en: Yeah, but he thinks he can fake speaking German with just three words.
translation.ja: ３つの単語だけで乗り切れるって

translation.en: We have the same words in Yiddish:
translation.ja: イディシュ語と同じだわ

translation.en: I will try that, if I ever go to a dinner party.
translation.ja: チャンスがあったら試してみる

translation.en: So you're really going back to practice now? What, so late?
translation.ja: 〝ポツダマープラッツ駅〞 もう遅いのに本当に練習に戻るの？ もう遅いのに本当に練習に戻るの？

translation.en: Yeah, I have to. The academy is open till midnight.
translation.ja: 学校は夜中まで開いてるから

translation.en: -I hope to see you around, Esty. -Yeah.

translation.ja: ドボルザーク 頑張って うん

translation.en: Yanky, one thing leads to another. You let her take piano lessons with that shiksa, right?
translation.ja: 〈ピアノのレッスンなど受けさせるからだ〉

translation.en: Schlomo Moskowitz takes his wife out to bars in Manhattan!
When you left the community, did you leave everything behind?
translation.ja: 〈君もすべて置いて行ったのか？〉

translation.en: I mean, even your clothes? Your phone?
Esty took nothing because it was the Sabbath and the eruv was broken. She had no choice.
translation.ja: 〈エスティの場合は安息日にエルブが壊れたせいだ〉

translation.en: Did you already check her phone for funny numbers?
The doctor's office called about blood test results and offered an appointment for an ultrasound next week.
translation.ja: 〈病院から 来週超音波検査の予約を取れと〉

translation.en: -[guard in German] Good evening! -[Dasia] Good evening!
And she didn't even take anything with her!
-That depends how you look at it. -She took the baby!
translation.ja: 〈考え方による〉 〈赤ん坊が一緒だわ〉

translation.en: Her crazy mother lives in Berlin!
I thought she came from England?
She came from Manchester to Williamsburg, but when she left Yanky's father-in-law, she moved to Germany.
translation.ja: 〈マンチェスターから嫁いで離婚後はドイツに越した〉

translation.en: We shouldn't have agreed to this marriage.
The apple doesn't fall far from the tree.
The rabbi wants me to go to Berlin?

translation.ja: 〈まあねいい思い出はないが〉

translation.en: [rabbi] Life is a never-ending battle between good and evil.
translation.ja: 〈人生は常に善と悪の葛藤だ〉

translation.en: Anyway, the boy can't handle a trip to Berlin on his own.
translation.ja: 〈彼１人でベルリンには行かせられない〉

translation.en: The rabbi wants me to go to Berlin with Yanky?
Of course he's going with you, Moishe!
You're a bride now, Esty. I will wait in the kitchen.
translation.ja: 〈花嫁になるんだよゆっくり話しな〉

translation.en: [in English] You stopped being my mother the day you left Williamsburg.
translation.ja: 母親なんかじゃないわ

translation.en: [in Yiddish] No. I will always be your mother.
[in English] No matter where I go.
I wanted to give you this.
[Esty's mom] It's paperwork. Proves your right to German citizenship.
translation.ja: ドイツ国籍を取得するための書類よ

translation.en: Because my parents, your grandparents, were born there.
translation.ja: 私の両親はドイツ生まれだから

translation.en: It's just in case you need somewhere else to go.
I'm getting married. Don't you get it?
I'm going to make a family with Yanky Shapiro.
translation.ja: ヤンキーと家族を作るの

translation.en: Lots of children. A real home.
translation.ja: 子供たちと温かい家庭

translation.en: I won't ever need anywhere else to go. This is what I want.
translation.ja: 私が求めていたものよ

translation.en: -OK, you think that now-- -Don't you tell me what I think.
-You don't even know me. -[Esty's mom] Maybe not.
translation.ja: 何も知らないで そうかもねでも その書類は持ってて

translation.en: But you keep those documents safe, please.
translation.ja: そうかもねでも その書類は持ってて

translation.en: Rabbi, I don't know if I'm the right--
Bring back Esther Shapiro and God will take care of you.
translation.ja: 〈彼女を連れ戻せば神の恩恵がある〉

translation.en: He will pay your debts. Work things out with your wife and children.
translation.ja: 〈借金はなくなり妻子ともやり直せるぞ〉

translation.en: The rabbi will do all that for me?
